text: Your right is to action, never to its results.
Evenness of mind is Yoga.
Yoga is skill in action.
Perform your duty without attachment.
Let the Self uplift the self.
The controlled mind is your best friend.
Be calm in success and failure.
He who is unattached gains true peace.
Desires flow into the still like rivers into the sea.
The wise see action in inaction.
A steady mind leads to peace.
Do not cling to pleasure or pain—both pass.
Act for duty, not reward.
Renounce outcomes; act from clarity and strength.
From stillness comes decisive action.
He who conquers himself is truly victorious.
The mind follows where attention dwells.
Self-doubt binds; knowledge liberates.
Know what must be done—and do it without fear.
Don’t shrink from your nature; rise to it.
What is born will die; what dies will be born again.
The wise are not shaken by life’s changes.
Attachment leads to desire, anger, and confusion.
Restrain the senses; let reason guide.
Act in harmony with your purpose, not to please others.
A person who acts without selfish aim is free.
Bring the wandering mind back to stillness.
The soul is not pierced, burned, wet, or broken.
He who sees clearly does not act selfishly.
The calm, steady person is not moved by praise or blame.
Be firm in resolve, soft in manner.
The peaceful mind sees truth.
Rest in the Self, not the senses.
One who neither grieves nor desires is wise.
Attachment fades through self-knowledge.
Withdraw like the tortoise—when needed, pull inward.
See the same Self in all beings.
The wise are not disturbed by opposites.
Keep a steady flame of awareness.
Move through life with purpose, not craving.
Action done without ego binds not.
One who gives up all expectations is at peace.
The unshaken sees loss and gain as the same.
Inaction in fear is not freedom—wise action is.
Do not hate or crave what comes and goes.
Choose clarity over comfort.
A disciplined mind is a source of joy.
The world acts through the qualities of nature—don’t take it personally.
Wisdom turns even the worst karma to ash.
Become firm in self-understanding; it won’t fail you.
Detachment brings strength; selfishness brings fear.
Know yourself—this is the path to true freedom.
